topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54ee56216368720a85502000#post_54ee56216368720a85502000
[bq="uc9"]"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54ee52a36368720b0e660c00#post_54ee52a36368720b0e660c00
No offense to pokemon fans, but when you get down to it pokemon's morals are up their ass cause "play with your favorite pokemon..... But if you play with your favorite pokemon instead and actually enjoy the games don't even fucking bother trying to win competitions with them shitlord"

What I mean by this:
Pokemon:
Winning > Competitiveness >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> playing with pokemon you like


Idunno games where it's intentionally stacked to where if you don't play how the creators want you you instantly die don't appeal to me.  I know it's a completely different genre all together, but I love LoL; I play it at least once a day; why do I love it so much?  Cause even though it's not the greatest game and obviously there are champions that are overpowered it doesn't force you to play champions you fucking despise to win.  Hell I could play adc Ahri (Ahri's my fav btw) against 5 tanks and while I would get killed a lot I could still have a chance at winning; no matter how stacked the match is you still have a very decent chance of winning.  No one is making you play Teemo and going, "if you don't play Teemo even though you fucking despise him then don't bother playing".



I know my dislike towards pokemon is irrational, but I have no interest in ever playing the games again because I would rather lose with a pokemon I like rather than forgo any and all enjoyment for the sake of winning.


Also have a joke: How does Smogon replace a bulb?  They don't; they just ban the bulb for being broken.

Tl:dr; I would rather lose with a character I like than win characters I fucking hate.  Imagine a game where you *HAVE* to play as characters you want to throttle to win.[/bq]
If you don't like the competitive scene, just stay out of it like I do. There are other past times to be had while playing Pokemon that don't involve having to build a "perfect team."

For example, if you're more interested in the glory of bragging rights, becoming a shiny hunter is a good way to go. Pretty much anyone can do it, and there's not really any pressure in doing it unless you inflict it upon yourself.

topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54ee58366368726cb5620c00#post_54ee58366368726cb5620c00
But in video games I like playing competive matches for the challenge and to get better cause skill based challenges are fun, but you're saying that I should play pokemon and remove what I define fun in order to find fun in it.

Isn't that a bit of a contradiction to say that in order to make something fun you have to remove what the person finds fun?  And there is why I can't stand playing pokemon cause I want fun out of games through being challenged by other players but in order for me to play against other players I would have sacrifice either playing with pokemon I like or give up the fun aspect of playing against other players all together for the sake of preserving one extra fan for the franchise.

Tl:dr; I like having the challenge of playing against other skilled characters to have fun, but I don't want to play games where I have to play with characters I hate in order to do so.  If anything you're making me hate pokemon more.
